content: bottom needle join yarn and pick up a stitch at the corner of the heel at the beginning of the row then knit across the rown and pick up two stitches at the end of the row on the first needle only for the second needle pick up a single stitch at the corner of the heel knit across the row and pick up a single stitch at the corner of the heel at the end of the row that should give you 34 stitches on each needle and will eliminate the need to sew up any little hole on the far side or the end of the row of the heel you may still have to sew up a bit on the beginning of the row side of the heel but you will have the tail from the heel yarn with which to easily do that now start decreasing for the heel do the decreases exactly as described for the toe on the top down sock above doing the kitchnering at 14 or 12 stitches depending on how wide your heel is or how the striping pattern is working in your yarn thoughts if you have thicker fingering yarn you can knit the socks on a us1 5 but i would decrease your stitch count by 4 and only cast on 60 i think it looks best when you have the heel fall in the middle of a stripe so will sometimes add a row or 2 to the foot the make that happen also if the stripes are 4 row or longer then when i work my ribbing i work the first row of each color change in knit then continue to rib after the first row i find this is more aesthetically pleasing than having those odd purl bumps and it doesn t affect the look of the ribbing
